# Joint Service Plan

## Introduction
The Joint Service Plan is a collaborative document created by both the student and parent/guardian to formalize the service learning experience. This plan ensures everyone is aligned on expectations, timelines, and safety considerations before beginning community service activities.

## Creating Your Joint Service Plan

### Timeline Development
Work together to establish specific dates for:
- Service project start and completion
- Regular check-in points to assess progress
- Documentation deadlines (photos, reflections, supervisor evaluations)
- Final presentation or reflection submission

### Resource Identification
List all resources needed for successful completion:
- Transportation arrangements
- Materials or supplies required
- Contact information for site supervisors
- Any costs involved and how they'll be covered
- Technology needs for documentation

### Safety Checklist
Complete the safety assessment together by reviewing:
- Potential hazards at the service site
- Emergency contact procedures
- Appropriate attire and protective equipment
- Communication plan during service hours
- Physical limitations and accommodations

## Finalizing Your Plan
Once completed, both student and parent/guardian should sign the document, indicating mutual agreement on all aspects of the service learning experience. Submit your completed Joint Service Plan to your Excel High School advisor before beginning your service activities.
